changes: Moved the slider for "Blur" higher in the video settings list
Increased Mr. Chipper's health from 270 to 350
Increased Nightmare BB's health from 250 to 350
Bonnie now has Birthday instead of Speed Song
Increased Purple Guys's health from 240 to 280
The minimum duration between attacks is now 0.75 seconds instead of 0.8 seconds
Increased Unscrew 2's chance of unscrewing an enemy from 25% to 40%
Increased Unscrew 2's chance of unscrewing a boss from 0.5% to 2%
Increased Unscrew's chance of unscrewing an enemy from 10% to 25%
Increased Unscrew's chance of unscrewing a boss from 0.1% to 1%
The attack color for 4th Wall is now Blaze Orange instead of Black
Increased Jack o' Chica's health from 260 to 350
Increased Slasher's chance of criting from 3% to 8%
Added tooltips when hovering over bytes in the byte selection menu
technical: Splash text can now have a author assigned to them by appending " \\\ Author Name" to the end of the splash
Renamed the `boost_stats` parameter for attacks to `apply_party_stats` to be consistent with byte definitions
New registry: `chips`
- Defined at `data/<namespace>/chips/<id>.json`
- `rarity` parameter controls what rarity the chip is
- - Can be either `common`, `uncommon`, or `rare`
- `apply_party_stats` object parameter works just like it does in byte definitions
- `run_attack` object parameter works just like it does in byte definitions
- `apply_effect` object parameter works just like it does in attack definitions
- `crit_chance_modifier` object parameter to override crit chances of attacks
- - `target_player` percentage parameter overrides crit chance for attacks targeting the player party
- - `target_enemy` percentage parameter overrides crit chance for attacks targeting the enemy party
- - `allow_all_attacks_to_crit` boolean parameter allows all attacks to crit when true
- - - Does not affect enemy attacks
- - - This parameter does not affect an attacks chance to crit
- - - Attacks that defined their crit chance as 0% would still never crit if this was the only parameter defined in this object
- - `ignore_all_special_cases` boolean parameter to ignore special cases for crit chances
- - - Ignore certain tags such as the `one_shot_attacks_work` enemy tag
New registry: `levels`
- Defined at `data/<namespace>/levels/<id>.json`
- `author` string parameter denotes the name of who created the level
- `width` int parameter defines how many tiles wide the level is
- `height` int parameter defines how many tiles tall the level is
- `player_controller` parameter defines how the player should be controlled when in the level
- - Currently, the only available controller is `topdown`
- See `fwb:default_empty` as an example for how levels are defined
New `apply_enemy_party_stats` parameter for attack definitions
- Acts just like `apply_party_stats` but it applies to the enemy party instead of the player's
New `blocked_by_walls` attack tag for attacks
- Completely negates damage of the attack if a neon wall instance exists
- Only works for attacks that are of type `generic.toss` or `generic.swarm`
- Intended for enemy attacks
fixes: Fixed getting more party stat boosts than intended when using a stat boosting byte
Fixed getting a party stat boost despite not having any bytes equipped if a previous battle had a stat boosting byte equipped
Fixed crit particles causing an uncaught error when created
removed: Removed High Contrast video setting due to it being buggy and unstable
Removed code to download a different gamedata.zip on startup on April 1st
other: Stopped using deprecated "Embin's Utils" JSON blocks in the code for settings buttons
